title: Mountain Valley View: Two Hikers Taking in the Scenery
caption: A hiking couple pauses on a wildflower slope to admire a wide green valley and snowy peaks.

image.alt: People walk through a city street during a morning commute.

fullDescription.en: Two hikers (a man and a woman) stand on a mountain trail, looking over a wide green valley with snow-capped peaks and wildflowers.
fullDescription.fa: دو کوهنورد (یک مرد و یک زن) stand on کوهستان مسیر, looking over یک دره‌ی سبز و وسیع with قله‌های پوشیده از برف and گل‌های وحشی.

advancedEnglish.en: From a high viewpoint, a pair of hikers pause to take in an expansive alpine landscape—green meadows below and snow-capped mountains beyond. Their backpacks and steady stance suggest a long trek, and the bright, calm light creates a peaceful, adventurous mood.

questions.question: What is the best overall description of 'Morning Commute Through the City'?
choices: A calm indoor meeting with formal presentations
People in a public setting engaged in an everyday activity
A private ceremony with an audience and a stage
A laboratory experiment with specialized equipment
questions.explanation: The scene title and context point to a public setting and routine activity rather than a formal ceremony, lab, or meeting.

speakingTasks.prompt: Describe the scene in 'Morning Commute Through the City'. What do you notice first?
Explain how the setting in 'Morning Commute Through the City' affects the mood of the people.
Predict what might happen next in 'Morning Commute Through the City' and give one reason.

writingTasks.prompt: Write a short description of the photo and summarize the main mood in 'Morning Commute Through the City'.
Explain the relationship between the people and the setting in 'Morning Commute Through the City'. Use at least two specific details.
writingTasks.sampleAnswer: In 'Morning Commute Through the City', the setting provides clear context for the people’s actions. Overall, the scene feels purposeful because the subjects seem engaged and oriented toward a shared goal. For example, their body language suggests focus, and the environment appears to support that activity. As a result, the mood is more organized than casual, which indicates that the moment is part of a routine rather than a spontaneous event.

writingTasks.prompt: Some people prefer busy environments, while others prefer quiet ones. Using 'Morning Commute Through the City' as inspiration, state your preference and support it with reasons.
writingTasks.sampleAnswer: I prefer quieter environments because they help me think clearly and work efficiently. In contrast, busy places can be distracting and make it harder to focus. For example, when I study in a calm space, I can organize my ideas and finish tasks faster. A possible explanation is that fewer interruptions reduce mental fatigue. Overall, choosing a quiet environment leads to better concentration and less stress, which improves my performance.

examTips: Start with a one-sentence overview before details.
Use location phrases (foreground/background) to organize your description.
Avoid guessing; hedge with 'it appears' or 'it is likely'.
Include 2–3 specific details (objects, actions, setting) to support ideas.
Use linking words (overall, in contrast, as a result) for coherence.
Speak steadily and manage time: plan 5 seconds, speak 40–45 seconds.

descriptions.beginner: Two hikers (a man and a woman) stand on a mountain trail, looking over a wide… It takes place in a busy city street during morning hours. Use simple sentences to describe people, actions, and objects.
descriptions.intermediate: Two hikers (a man and a woman) stand on a mountain trail, looking over a wide green valley with snow-capped peaks and wildflowers. Setting: a busy city street during morning hours. Atmosphere: busy, neutral, focused, rushed. This lesson builds both everyday and academic language for describing the photo clearly, making inferences, and organizing ideas for TOEFL tasks.
descriptions.advanced: Two hikers (a man and a woman) stand on a mountain trail, looking over a wide green valley with snow-capped peaks and wildflowers. The setting suggests: a busy city street during morning hours. Overall tone: busy, neutral, focused, rushed. A strong response highlights concrete visual evidence, then adds cautious inference (what is likely happening and why) without over-claiming. You will build academic vocabulary and structured answers for TOEFL-style speaking, writing tasks.
descriptions.simple: Two hikers (a man and a woman) stand on a mountain trail, looking over a wide… It takes place in a busy city street during morning hours. Use simple sentences to describe people, actions, and objects.

sceneNotes: Focus on what you can SEE (people, setting, actions).
- Simple: Mostly Present Continuous (am/is/are + V-ing) + basic 'There is/There are' for objects.
- Intermediate: Adds prepositional phrases (at/on/near), quantifiers (several/a few/a lot of), and 1 relative clause (who/that/where).
- Advanced: Adds inference language (probably/likely/might), contrast/linkers (while/whereas/in addition), and optional passive voice when relevant.
Add 1–2 inferences (why they are there, how they feel).
Use at least 2 collocations in your speaking/writing.

proDescriptions.label: TOEFL Speaking (45–60s)
proDescriptions.text: In this photo, two hikers are standing on a hillside covered with wildflowers. They are looking out at a wide green valley surrounded by tall, snow-capped mountains. Both of them have backpacks, which suggests they are on a long hike. The scene feels peaceful and impressive, as if they are taking a break to appreciate nature.

proDescriptions.label: Academic Description
proDescriptions.text: The image depicts two backpackers positioned on an elevated meadow, facing a panoramic valley framed by mountain ridges. The composition emphasizes depth: wildflowers in the foreground lead the eye toward a distant settlement and snow-covered peaks. The lighting is soft and natural, reinforcing a tranquil atmosphere associated with outdoor recreation.

proDescriptions.label: Narrative Style
proDescriptions.text: They finally stop at the edge of the meadow, shoulder straps digging in just enough to remind them of the climb. Below them, the valley opens like a map—green fields, winding paths, and mountains that seem to guard the horizon. For a moment, they say nothing; the view does the talking.

sceneDescription: Two hikers, seen from behind, stand on a hillside carpeted with wildflowers and fresh grass. Both wear backpacks—one orange and one green—and they face a broad, sunlit valley that stretches toward distant, snow-capped mountains. The bright sky and soft light create a calm, appreciative mood, as if they have reached a rewarding viewpoint after a long walk.

grammarUsed.en: Present continuous for actions now, there is/are for visible objects, and adjectives/prepositions for setting and mood.
grammarUsed.fa: حال استمراری برای کارهای در جریان، there is/are برای اشیای قابل مشاهده، و صفت/حروف اضافه برای توصیف محیط و حس.

en.tense: Present Continuous (am/is/are + V‑ing) for actions happening now in the photo.
howToBuild: Choose the subject (who?): they / the family / the coworkers.
Pick an action you can SEE and use am/is/are + V‑ing.
Add place details with prepositions: at, in, on, near.
Add one short feeling sentence: They look… / The atmosphere feels…
examples: The couple is Standing side-by-side.
There are 2 backpacks and Mountain trail in Mountain valley viewpoint.
The atmosphere feels Calm.

fa.tense: حال استمراری (am/is/are + فعل ing) برای کارهایی که همین الآن در عکس در حال انجام است.
howToBuild: اول فاعل را انتخاب کن (چه کسی؟): they / the family / the coworkers.
یک کاری که در عکس می‌بینی انتخاب کن و با am/is/are + ing بساز.
جزئیات مکان را با حروف اضافه اضافه کن: at, in, on, near.
یک جمله کوتاه درباره حس اضافه کن: They look… / The atmosphere feels…
examples: آن‌ها در حال Standing side-by-side هستند.
در Mountain valley viewpoint 2 backpacks و Mountain trail دیده می‌شود.
فضا Calm به نظر می‌رسد.

scenarios.title: A memory
scenarios.en: Last weekend, I found myself on Mountain valley viewpoint. A hiking couple pauses on a wildflower slope to admire a wide green valley and snowy peaks. At first, I noticed 2 backpacks, Mountain trail, Wildflowers/meadow and the way people were standing side-by-side. Then I looked closer: their clothing (Outdoor jackets (dark/navy and light/neutral tones), Hiking pants/leggings) and their expressions made the scene feel calm, inspired, enjoying nature. After that, something small happened that changed the mood, and we had to respond quickly. In the end, we solved it, and the moment became a story I still remember.
scenarios.fa: آخرِ هفته‌ی قبل Mountain valley viewpoint بودم. A hiking couple pauses on a wildflower slope to admire a wide green valley and snowy peaks. اول 2 backpacks، Mountain trail و Wildflowers/meadow را دیدم و اینکه آدم‌ها چطور Standing side-by-side. بعد دقیق‌تر نگاه کردم: لباس‌ها (Outdoor jackets (dark/navy and light/neutral tones) و Hiking pants/leggings) و حالت چهره‌ها باعث شد فضا Calm، Inspired و Enjoying nature به نظر برسد. بعدش یک اتفاق کوچک افتاد که حال‌وهوا را عوض کرد و مجبور شدیم سریع واکنش نشان بدهیم. آخرش حلش کردیم و همان لحظه تبدیل شد به خاطره‌ای که هنوز یادم می‌ماند.

grammarUsed.en: Past simple with time marker (last weekend) and sequencing (at first/then/after that/in the end).
grammarUsed.fa: گذشته ساده با قید زمان و ترتیب رخدادها (اول/بعد/بعدش/آخرش).

en.tense: Past Simple (V2) to tell a short memory, plus sequencing words (first/then/finally).
sentenceStructure: Time markers: yesterday / last week / a few minutes ago.
howToBuild: Start with a time phrase: Yesterday, Last weekend, A few minutes ago…
Change the main action into past simple (reviewed, chose, played…).
Use sequencing words to make a clear story: first, then, after that, finally.
End with a result or feeling: Everyone felt… / It turned out…
examples: Yesterday, the couple standed side-by-side.
Then, the couple checked 2 backpacks and continued.
Finally, they felt Calm about the outcome.

fa.tense: گذشته ساده (Past Simple) برای تعریف یک خاطره کوتاه، همراه با کلمات ترتیب‌دهنده (first/then/finally).
sentenceStructure: عبارات زمانی: yesterday / last week / a few minutes ago
howToBuild: با یک عبارت زمانی شروع کن: Yesterday, Last weekend, A few minutes ago…
فعل اصلی را به گذشته ساده تبدیل کن (reviewed, chose, played…).
از کلمات ترتیب‌دهنده استفاده کن: first, then, after that, finally.
با نتیجه یا حس تمام کن: Everyone felt… / It turned out…
examples: دیروز، The couple standed side-by-side.
بعد، The couple 2 backpacks را بررسی کرد و ادامه داد.
در نهایت، آن‌ها درباره نتیجه Calm بودند.

scenarios.title: Reflection
scenarios.en: Over the past few months, I have started paying attention to scenes like this. I have noticed that details such as 2 backpacks, Mountain trail, Wildflowers/meadow, Distant mountains are not background; they guide the story. I have also learned how actions like looking at the view can signal feelings such as calm, inspired, enjoying nature. Since then, I have taken more time to observe before I speak, and my descriptions have become clearer and more specific.
scenarios.fa: در چند ماه گذشته شروع کرده‌ام به صحنه‌هایی مثل این بیشتر دقت کنم. متوجه شده‌ام جزئیاتی مثل 2 backpacks، Mountain trail، Wildflowers/meadow و Distant mountains فقط «پس‌زمینه» نیستند؛ آن‌ها مسیر داستان را تعیین می‌کنند. همچنین یاد گرفته‌ام کارهایی مثل Looking at the view چطور می‌تواند احساساتی مثل Calm، Inspired و Enjoying nature را نشان بدهد. از آن زمان بیشتر قبل از حرف زدن مشاهده می‌کنم و توصیف‌هایم واضح‌تر و دقیق‌تر شده است.

grammarUsed.en: Present perfect to connect past learning to the present, plus since/over the past to frame experience.
grammarUsed.fa: حال کامل برای وصل کردن یادگیری گذشته به حال، همراه با «در چند ماه گذشته/از آن زمان».

en.tense: Present Perfect (have/has + past participle) to connect past experience to the present; use since/for/already/yet.
howToBuild: Say what has happened up to now (experience/result).
Use since (a starting point) or for (a duration).
Add a contrast or reflection: however, although, even though.
Finish with what they are doing now (present continuous) if needed.
examples: The couple has already handled similar situations before.
The couple has learned to stay Calm in Mountain valley viewpoint.
Although it looks routine, the details have mattered.

fa.tense: حال کامل (have/has + شکل سوم فعل) برای ربط دادن گذشته به حال؛ همراه با since/for/already/yet.
howToBuild: بگو تا همین الآن چه تجربه/نتیجه‌ای اتفاق افتاده.
از since (نقطه شروع) یا for (مدت زمان) استفاده کن.
یک جمله‌ی بازتاب/تضاد اضافه کن: however, although, even though.
اگر لازم شد با یک جمله حال استمراری وضعیت الآن را بگو.
examples: The couple قبلاً موقعیت‌های مشابهی را تجربه کرده است.
The couple یاد گرفته است در Mountain valley viewpoint Calm بماند.
اگرچه کار روتین به نظر می‌رسد، جزئیات مهم بوده‌اند.

scenarios.title: A challenge
scenarios.en: If we were to replay this moment on Mountain valley viewpoint, one small change could create a big problem. If 2 backpacks, Mountain trail had been missing or damaged, we would have had to improvise. Someone might have said, “We should slow down and check,” and another person could have replied that we were running out of time. In a situation like this, we should prioritize safety and clarity, even if it means changing the plan. If I had ignored those details, I might have misunderstood the whole scene.
scenarios.fa: اگر قرار بود این لحظه در Mountain valley viewpoint دوباره تکرار شود، یک تغییر کوچک می‌توانست یک مشکل بزرگ بسازد. اگر 2 backpacks و Mountain trail نبود یا آسیب دیده بود، مجبور می‌شدیم بداهه تصمیم بگیریم. ممکن بود کسی بگوید «باید آهسته‌تر برویم و بررسی کنیم» و نفر دیگری جواب بدهد که وقت کم داریم. در چنین موقعیتی بهتر است ایمنی و شفافیت را در اولویت بگذاریم، حتی اگر مجبور شویم برنامه را تغییر بدهیم. اگر آن جزئیات را نادیده می‌گرفتم، شاید کل صحنه را اشتباه می‌فهمیدم.

grammarUsed.en: Conditionals for hypotheticals, modals for advice/possibility, and short reported speech (might have said/could have replied).
grammarUsed.fa: شرطی‌ها برای موقعیت فرضی، افعال کمکی برای امکان/پیشنهاد، و نقل‌قول غیرمستقیم برای بازگویی گفت‌وگو.

en.tense: Mixed grammar for higher-level storytelling: conditionals, modals (might/must), and reported speech.
sentenceStructure: Second conditional: If + past simple, would + base verb.
Third conditional: If + had + V3, would have + V3.
Modals of deduction: might/must/can't + base verb.
Reported speech: He said (that) … / She asked if …
howToBuild: Describe the challenge and add a hypothetical solution (If…, would…).
Use modals to infer causes from the photo (They might…, It must…).
Add reported speech for realism: Someone said that…
Finish with a consequence or lesson learned.
examples: If the couple had checked 2 backpacks earlier, they would have avoided a mistake.
They might be under pressure, but they must stay Calm.
The supervisor said that every detail mattered.

fa.tense: گرامر ترکیبی سطح بالا: شرطی‌ها، افعال کمکی (might/must) و نقل قول غیرمستقیم (reported speech).
sentenceStructure: شرطی نوع دوم: If + past simple, would + فعل ساده.
شرطی نوع سوم: If + had + V3, would have + V3.
نقل قول غیرمستقیم: He said (that)… / She asked if…
howToBuild: چالش را بگو و یک راه‌حل فرضی اضافه کن (If…, would…).
با مدال‌ها درباره علت‌ها حدس بزن (might/must).
برای واقعی‌تر شدن از reported speech استفاده کن.
در پایان نتیجه یا درسِ داستان را بگو.
examples: اگر The couple زودتر 2 backpacks را چک کرده بود، اشتباه را جلوگیری می‌کرد.
ممکن است تحت فشار باشند، اما باید Calm بمانند.
سرپرست گفت که هر جزئیاتی مهم است.
